column4: hey,, hmm i jsut switched to Fluxbox... which filemanager besides nautilus am I able to use here?
xthanks buddys
pcmanfm, thunar, mc  are some choices
wget and httrack
did you edit ~/.bashrc?
think so.. a bit..if [ "$TERM" != "dumb" ] && [ -x /usr/bin/dircolors ]; then eval `/usr/bin/dircolors -b ~/.dircolors` alias ls='ls --color=auto'
see if it works without the conditionals
well shouldnt I be able to load dircolors in gnome-terminal easily?
what does just 'dircolors -b ~/.dircolors' return?
syntax@nutshell:~$ dircolors -b ~/.dircolors
and so this doesn't work?:  eval `dircolors -b ~/.dircolors`
well still, the values arent the same as in my .dircolors file
were the values right before?  When you saw the output?
yep..
how are you testing the values?
well entering dircolors shows up the current configuration ?
no.  echo $LS_COLORS
omg it worx...      .. whats that dircolors command without any arguments doing then?
giving you the default from the database
alright thanx=)
no problem
yeah
you can put the if statements in there.  I just suggested removing them for testing
install the "vim" package.  only vim-tiny is installed by default
